comments.body: Love the idea.

I think that there could be a coastal variant that replicates the coastal areas in Greece, with rocky shores, and plains containing olives and grapes, but a more arid variant could be a bit hilly with succulents, prickly pear cotton, almonds, Coyotes, poison oak, roadrunner, and yucca, similar to chaparral areas in southern california
Ask Mojang to Add this After The 1.17 as part of the Biome Update
Hi there, please don't use all bold in your posts. I took it out to make things easier to read. Thank you!
Alright i'll stop Nova "inkycatz' Barlow

I think instead of the Nether, it should be like the overworld but with amplified terrain. In this dimension, you will get a constant freezing effect unless you wear a piece of leather armor, and maybe iceologers could spawn there.
Now since we are about to start getting frost damage this wouldn't be a bad idea
I think this biome would only generate in the middle of the jungle.
Also, wasp hives would be cool

And make carnivores plants that if you walk into them by accident, they would eat you and you can‚Äôt escape unless something destroys it from the outside. They should also be hard not to fall into, like, make them disguised as good plants that would give you food or something

Instead of a new biome, improve jungle biomes that are currently in the game instead.    Here is my suggestion for improving jungle biomes.    Jungle biomes will generate with extremely dense overgrown vegetation consisting of jungle trees now generating extremely densely together with large leaf canopies with some openings in the leaf canopies to allow some sunlight to shine through while the lighting is still dark enough to allow hostile mobs to spawn during daytime in dark areas in the jungle, and large plants that obscure line of sight.    Creepers and Poisonous Spiders (Cave Spiders) will spawn very often in jungle biomes.    Hostile mobs can emerge out or hide within the overgrown plants to attack / ambush players, and ranged attack hostile mobs can attack / ambush players while they're concealed within the overgrown plants.

 

A link to my feedback suggestion regarding hostile mob spawning and behavior in jungle biomes is posted below, feel free to upvote my feedback suggestion if my suggestion is something you want implemented into the game.

 

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360056140491-Hostile-Mob-Spawning-and-Behavior-in-Jungle-Biomes
@WalnutTooth5237 You still haven't posted details about the features posted in your feedback suggestion.
It could also hold bio luminescent plant and animals to add a more  beautiful atmosphere
can i add to this idea. poison darts and new montsters.

also in these jungle biome are bogs that have mud monsters and poison gas. gas give an effect called "Bane" where the gas causes a half heart every 15 seconds and blures vision plus confuses the players movement controls
In the boilumisnet part f the forest i think adding sprites and fairies would be cool
I think that Minecraft really needs this biome for sure! I would add to the adventures you could have in the Overworld!

Here's a post I made a few weeks ago, that's been doing pretty well, about a new structure/mob

The Nether Gate (New Nether/Overworld Dungeon)

The Gate Keeper (New Nether Mini Boss)

I agree that our current dimensions need more love. You got my vote.

I think there are new mobs such as chameleons and orangutans, as well as ocelots, parrots, and frogs that are planned to be implemented.
Especially, I think there is a parrot color that has only that biome.
It's like a colorful color like Coconut Lorikeet and a pink color like Galah.

I feel like there could be two types of palm trees that could come from the same sapling, the regular palm tree could be found on sand beaches that had a warm ocean beside them, while the giant palm trees (which would work like the jungle trees) could be found in jungles that had enough surface space (large jungle biomes), and there could be a new subbiome "the oasis" that could only generate in sufficiently large desert biomes, therefore making water puddles rarer in deserts and in the oasis beside the water pools there could be regular and giant palm trees as well as sugarcanes and this would be the only places where pigs and cows and other regular animals could spawn naturally in deserts, so this could be a valuable place. the palm tree wood log could be like the jungle wood but the bark could have this wavey zig zag diamond/romb like patterns and the colour of the wooden planks may be a goldenish wood colour. the coconuts could be optional but if they added them they could be like cocoa but retextured and could serve as a new type of food, or they could be dropped by the leaves just like apples with oaks.
and new fruit

We could use new palm wood, coconuts and bananas. Something like this is missing in Minecraft, and it would be a great decorative element, for example, a new biome, which would be an archipelago with islands. It would certainly spice up nature in this wonderful game. New animals such as cute monkeys or lemurs, and possibly crabs that would add an amazing vibe to the generated world. I hope that someday Mojang will add something of these unique elements/mobs. Greetings to readers!
that would be a nice change to the jungle and swamp biomes
How about a new mob in the dimension skulk creacher
I love skulk so this will be perfect but sadly you have to sneak everywhere you go üòê

I love this idea. Obviously, the Ancient City rectangle thing of reinforced deepslate would become a portal to that new dimension. to activate the portal you would need to do something really hard, like striking a warden with lightning when it's less than 10 blocks away from the portal.
The skulk dimension should have a bedrock roof and an endless void floor.
Please, make this idea famous!
YES! this is what I posted!! its so important! like, maybe fallen trees, or rapids, or REAL WATERFALLS THAT MAKE SENSE INSTEAD OF ONE BLOCK WATER SOURCES XD. yes yes yes upvote
Great idea! I was thinking they should add this in addition to beach update.
I want this to be added in 1.18
You could also add river rapids, decending mountain and waiting to kill with white water.
This would bee a cool idea that would give bees more purpose. I also have an idea where we could add honey slimes that would drop honey instead of slime

This is a great idea. But I was thinking that this might better fit wasps than bees. If wasps were in Minecraft than I think that they should be found in these honeycomb hollows and not bees. But that's just my idea. Just trying to add on.
in that biome there will be new mobs?
and/or cave temples

I like this idea but let's elaborate.

I think it would be cool if a mountain temple was made out of quartz or a similar block, although I'm not sure if that would have lore implications, since quartz is from the Nether. They might also be built out of terracotta or similar materials, with the main look of the temple as white and red.

It might be cool if the Illusioner mobs (in the game's code but unused) inhabited the temple. It would be cool if some of the floor was powder snow, and if you fall through there's a dungeons, and maybe even a cave carved into the mountain
I like the idea of a temple in the mountains perhaps it can be made out of ice or a block that you can find in mountain biomes similar to how desert temples are made out of sandstone.

New temple with new blocks, new mobs, new loots

The temple has new blocks that can charge any player / mobs wearing metal armor, tools, or weapons (can't be mined like trial of chamber vaults/spawner)

New mobs that will reflect damage if attacked with metal weapons (iron, gold, diamond, netherite)

New loots: scepters, that use charged bolt, damage increase for metal armor

It seems to be an oversight that players can create all manner of world configurations, but the seed has to be specified explicitly in the configuration. Changing the seed is not easy.

The seed is currently a numeric value. What's needed are special values that allow random seeds. Perhaps "random" for a random seed and "inherit" or something similar to use the same seed as the global world seed.
I honestly feel like this not being added is more of a bug than it needing to be required as a feature.
This would be awesome, I wanted to create a "spirit world" that is like the one found in the old Witchery mod back in 1.7.10 but that can't really be done if I can't automatically use the world seed.
I mean we already have things like this in json with "entity":"this", so you should be able to do "seed":"world" or something to automatically set it to something
This totally needs to be a thing; I was so shocked finding out it couldn't be done.
if you want me to vote for this, you would have to tell me about the dimension and the boss mob
Yea plz tell more about this

I like the idea, especially the ash blizzard and basalt peaks, but I think it should generate above the bedrock ceiling instead of just under it. Dinnerbone once mentioned that he would like to utilize the space for something new and I think this is the perfect opportunity to do so! To access the roof of the Nether, players would have to look for rare 'gashes' in the bedrock that lead into the Nether Peaks, a new sort of 'sub-dimension' for the Nether.

Blaze berries could be used to create a new food- Pemmican. Pemmican is a good created with four berries and one steak, and is very nutritious. It can be eaten three times. Two variants exist- Hoglin pemmican and normal pemmican.
Lava leaves could be a new potion ingredient- These grow in deep lava or on magma, and are used in potions of lava sight. These could also be very rare.
Fire roots- Grow from the nether roof. These grow bulbs which can be ground into dust, which can be put into foods, and provides a small strength or speed buff.

A massive cave updated is needed to revamp the underground world of Minecraft. I have a number of requests for this type of feature.

- More Ores

- New Cave Dedicated Mobs

- Cave Biomes

- More Underground Structures

- MORE MINECART TRACKS AND CAPABILITIES***

I think an update focused on amplifying mining/caves just how there was an update doing the same for villages would be most welcome. It would definitely make mining more interesting since for the most part, you're just looking for diamonds, iron, or coal; and your biggest threats are surprise creepers, falling from the top of a ravine, and lava. An update expanding on mines and caves would be really cool.

You mean different kinds of stones to dicentivize strip mining and deeper worlds, right? I'd like that. I think making the depths harder than they are now is kinda crucial to reestablish any kind of difficulty curve, especially with a cave update. I love the idea of less caves, but bigger caves.

For difficulty, I'd imagine something like thick atmosphere that reduces lightsources or field of view. Maybe new mobs that only spawn past a certain level. Maybe even Nether mobs and netherrack by bedrock (I secretly still wish you could mine down to the Nether). I'd like mobs that disregard or even destroy torches, because regular torches make the underground way to cheap to clear out IMO.

Hard stone sounds great, it really means soft-blocked progression and I love it. If it means the deeper you go, the harder strip mining gets and the more rewarding caving is, I'm 100% on board. Maybe to balance it out, we say that there's gunpowder deposits down below. So, if you can't mine it, blow it up?
Rather than add new blocks, what if mining speed decreased slightly as you went lower?

In order to make this a more community friendly feature, you could connect it to the level of difficulty of the world, or have it as a specific world generation option. Such a change could create a lot of backlash since it would overhaul parts of Minecraft's difficulty. It also undermines the simplicity of Minecraft, which is highly regarded. But overall it is really a great concept for Minecraft.

I was thinking of submitting a similar idea since the simple progression even in the beginning of the game, feels a bit too easy. I was thinking of just three layers: Soft Stone, Medium or just Stone, and Hard Stone. The Soft would be mined with at least wooden tools, Medium with stone, and Hard with iron. The higher layers would also not contain any ores of the lower layers, and each layer has a specific set of potential ores: Soft coal; Medium iron, lapis, potentially a new ore like copper, silver or bismuth; Hard gold, redstone, and of course diamonds. It would make mining more organised in a way, however, also boring. Probably the better solution is that each following layer also has the ores of the preceding one, maybe just rarer.

This is how I think the layers of stone should be and the minimum tool the stone should be mined with:
Stone                : Wooden Pickaxe     (In this layer and lower you can find coal ore)
Compact Stone: Stone Pickaxe         (In this layer and lower you can find iron ore)
Heavy Stone    : Iron Pickaxe            (In this layer and lower you can find diamond ore)
Dense Stone    : Diamond Pickaxe    (In this layer the deep dark biome(upcoming 1.17) will generate)
Core Stone       : Netherite Pickaxe   (Lava level should be in the border between core and dense layer. In core layer you can find a very precious material)
I like it, the end does need new biomes.

Just adding onto your idea- 

End Sand would be purplish-blue, does not fall until a play steps on it, similar to the Dripleaf Plant coming in 1.17. It can be smelted into Indigo Glass. 

Ender Cacti, maybe called "Endauro Cactus" (reference to Saguaro Cactus) should deal more damage than a regular cactus, but could be smelted into the all-new indigo dye. 

The magnetic thing I hadn't thought of, very creative!

However, I think End Sandstone should just be Endstone because we want to keep the end as bare as possible, And the End Scorpions are too similar to existing animals to be added.
Plss mojang update bow elytra and sheald
No MOJANG pls I hate the 1.19 PvP update pls don't bring back spam clicking. Pls just go back to as it was in 1.18
Por que vcs n√£o adicionam um novo mob como urso pardo um macaco ou um le√£o?
Yes please, allow us to generate all biomes. It becomes really boring with only one type.
1.16 already added a way to do this using datapacks.

I agree with this. I actually ran a test tonight in Java Edition 1.16.5 and noticed that a variety of different biomes still generated the floating islands the same way. There really is no reason why it has to all be one biome.

WeightedDig6048

1.16 already added a way to do this using datapacks.

How?! I did a google search and didn't find the answer on how.

I think I would still prefer if they made it do multiple biomes from the start or make it an option under customize button.

Yes please! I've always loved the Caves and the Floating Islands world types as theyre so much fun to play with, but it's really annoying when there is only one biome available, especially if I want to run a server. There should be an option at the top of the biome select list that lets you choose a dimension and it will automatically generate a normal assortment of biomes according to the dimension. Maybe you could choose whether you want lava oceans and water as well, so you could avoid weird water physics on your floating islands.

I'm a big fan of giving the bats a purpose, but I think it would be better if they did more beneficial things. Perhaps they could drop Gunpowder to reference guano, or attack any arthropod Mobs that try to hurt you? I'd love a bat biome, I just hope they're shown in a good, positive light.

Have the bats come out at dusk and eat any homeless bees, and come back at dawn. During the day, each floor block has a chance to gain a partial block of guano, which is able to be broken down into bone meal.

In plains biomes, have vampire bats land near and attack stationary animals and people for 1/2 heart damage.

I was going to make a similar post, so I've upvoted this one! 

A couple of minor differences I'd go with would be improved AI, which is similar to the turtles/Villagers where they save a "home" spot on the ceiling to return too and at set intervals the bats would be flying about the cave and then all slowly go sleep, maybe synced to the day/night cycle. This would create a really cool atmosphere view when the time swaps, plus it could also be a functional mechanic to tell if its day/night inside the caves as the bats will sleep in the day!

Then when the bats sleep, they would create a guano layer on the first solid block below, similar to a "snow" or "moss" layer. This would be a lag and server friendly alternative to it than having items like an "egg" spawn and could be used to create interesting guano farms!
Epic idea, definitely deserves more votes
The End most definitely needs to have more diversity
A little stretch with the names but over all a cool idea.
Wow nice

I had basically the same idea. This would be a great transition from jungle biome to beach biome. It would be good to generate small tropic island biomes surrounded by beach within the ocean biome.

I thought bananas could grow as a Banana Bunch block that breaks into 3-5 bananas. When a Banana is eaten it could leave a Banana Peel which can be turned into fertilizer (or for some other purpose?)

I thought a coconut block could be affected by gravity only when it is not attached to leaves. Harvesting takes a long time unless you use an axe. When you do it always breaks into two halves that can be eaten for small amounts of hunger, or crafted into terrible armour.

Gorillas could spawn here. The gorillas should come in 3 variants: silverback, normal (female), and baby. The baby will grow into a silverback 15% of the time. To be bred, a silverback and normal gorilla must be given a banana each. Silverbacks are fast and aggressive unless the player holds a banana. Silverbacks are also aggressive to zombies, and skeletons. The normal gorillas are neutral but will fight back when attacked. They drop xp and 0-1 banana peels as loot. I thought Gorillas were a good idea as they would be a powerful ally or dangerous opponent depending on how we interact.

Obviously I think these are great ideas. This biome could easily be called Archipelago or Jungle Outskirts as well.
I agree, i think blackstone should also generate in more biomes under netherack

Is there a way to bump suggestions so that they get more attention?

To be honest, if blackstone was under soul sand in the valleys, it would probably be more appropriate (assuming blackstone isn't destroyed like netherrack is by ghast explosions, anyway).
I love this idea! I hope it gets lots of votes!
The glass could be called desert opalite, and the property could be light could go through it but you would not be able to see though it.

I like this. It's similar to an idea I've had before.

I think the new block should be called Glazed Sand.

I actually even made a Glazed Sand texture:

Very outlandish but still makes complete sense, sounds like a subtle but very dangerous biome, though it'd probably have the same rarity as a mushroom biome. Maybe it could be something you could find with a cartographer's map. I'm very excited to see where this goes!

amazing idea, keeps a minecraft feel while also giving us new innovative ways of defence and attack, although i will admit the crystal part could use with a bit of changing, but other than that good idea!
i got a seed that has spikes made of sand next to a village is it rare? they are like ice spikes but made of sand???
Maybe instead of Charred Sand it is Sandglass, a gravity-affected transparentish block?
Maybe it can be called the "Thunderglass Desert," to avoid comparisons with the Glass Desert of Slime Rancher.
